result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Ryan Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Julie Ann Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant is still completing conditions.  Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. & Addendum
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alex Ryan Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court will allow for supervised visitation with ARJ in accorance with DMCPS.

Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alex Ryan Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Valuch.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

After the case was called on the record, Clerk received a response from the PD's Office regarding appointment of counsel. 
Court converted Status of Counsel hearing to Preliminary hearing. Clerk provided information to ADA Behling.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

-received and filed. 
Attorney William Hotchkiss

Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in Court.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE HAVAS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 10. COURT EXTENDED PRELIMINARY HEARING TIMELINES. Clerk provided information to the PD's Office. 
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alex Ryan Jones in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
